bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1941

div1.p: Clemons adds a copy of "A Mile Post" to the material at the Alderman Library, University of Virginia, on the conquest of yellow fever. He congratulates Hench for establishing the actual site of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1941
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
24 March 1941
HARRY CLEMONS
LIBRARIAN
MARY LOUISE DINWIDDIE
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
The copy of ‘A Mile Post’ has
been received, and we are very glad indeed to be
able to add to the material at the Alderman Library
on the conquest of yellow fever this important and
significant contribution of yours. It must be highly
gratifying to you to have been able to establish the
true site of Camp Lazear and the quality of Doctor
Lazear's quiet heroism. We are heartily apprecia-
tive both of your investigations and of this copy of
the statement of your conclusions.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian To Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
